content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "OFFICE OF ASSISTANT SECRETARY FOR INDIAN HEALTH." The Office of the Assistant Secretary for Indian Health is established within the Department of Health and Human Services to advocate for Indian health policy and promote consultation on related matters. The Assistant Secretary for Indian Health reports directly to the Secretary on policy and budget issues affecting Indian health. The Office of the Assistant Secretary for Indian Health collaborates with various agencies and programs within the Department of Health and Human Services to advise on and coordinate matters related to Indian health. The Assistant Secretary for Indian Health collaborates with agencies and programs within the Department of Health and Human Services. References to the Director of the Indian Health Service are now deemed to refer to the Assistant Secretary. Changes in pay rates for certain positions are also specified. The Assistant Secretary for Indian Health collaborates with agencies and programs within the Department of Health and Human Services, reporting directly to the Secretary on policy and budget matters affecting Indian health. The Assistant Secretary also works with the Assistant Secretary for Health on relevant Indian health issues. The Director of the Indian Health Service may serve as Assistant Secretary for Indian Health, advising various agencies and programs within the Department of Health and Human Services on matters of Indian health and coordinating related activities. The Indian Health Care Improvement Act is amended to replace the "Director of the Indian Health Service" with the "Assistant Secretary for Indian Health" in various sections.
